Topic.Title: Only 1 out of 10 Galaxy 4S is powered by Samsung's own Exynos 5 octa

Message.Msg: The TSMC 28nm that has been shipping for over a year has been the vanilla silicon process not the Hi-K metal gate version which Tegra 4 will use. Also Samsung did 32nm first which TSMC skipped. The S600 is still on TSMC's 28nm LP process which is why it is available in volume, it is a mature process now after initial yield/ramp problems last year which Qualcomm complained about publicly. The correct comparison would be between the Octa and Tegra 4 as they are both quad-core A15s on HKMG 28nm processes and as you can see Octa won that race to market.

Topic.Title: Only 1 out of 10 Galaxy 4S is powered by Samsung's own Exynos 5 octa

Message.Msg: When talk about technology node - we talk about the geometries first and foremost, and then the different flavors. Sorry, Sammy is 18 months late to the dance. And the will be 2 years late to the next dance - 20nm. For a company with mega fabs to manage only 1m parts with 3 months to get to that volume is pathetic. They are agnostic because they failed and they had to use a supposedly lower performance S600 part to top it because that's the only way to stay in business. There won't be a E6 when Logan shows up :0 - and they would be once again agnostic and put Logan in G5 - what else can they do - have a castrated E5 running against Logan in G5?

Topic.Title: Only 1 out of 10 Galaxy 4S is powered by Samsung's own Exynos 5 octa

Message.Msg: ""There won't be a E6 when Logan shows up :0 -""" Not only that. Samsung may come around even sooner - before Logan's time in 2015. When Tegra 4i gets validated and becomes available at the end of this year, Samsung will find this app processor to be "the" top choice to deploy for their largest (and fastest growing) midrange phone markets. All 4 selection criteria are met in the optimal sense: cost, performance, energy saving, and volume availability. For midrange smartphones, cost and volume availability would likely trump considerations for battery life and performance. And that will happen by Q1 2014, assuming that NV continues to proceed well with Tegra 4i's certification process. I think it's a small "IF" based on the optimism expressed by NV management in the past few weeks.

Topic.Title: Only 1 out of 10 Galaxy 4S is powered by Samsung's own Exynos 5 octa

Message.Msg: Absolutely! Sammy last hurrah - a castrated Big Little called E5.

Topic.Title: Only 1 out of 10 Galaxy 4S is powered by Samsung's own Exynos 5 octa

Message.Msg: "They are agnostic because they failed and they had to use a supposedly lower performance S600 part to top it because that's the only way to stay in business." the truth of the matter: for the high end, the processor diff made very little diff. to the success of failure of the end product plus minus 10%? no problema, end user didn't care. this can be seen by so many vanilla cell phone reviews I've read - the actual processor weren't even mentioned. nvda longs here are trying to tell people that the color of the wheel wells matter.

Topic.Title: Only 1 out of 10 Galaxy 4S is powered by Samsung's own Exynos 5 octa

Message.Msg: You're kidding yourself. E5 will replace S600 fully as soon as their 28nm HKMG is fully ramped and it will be ramped soon as Apple are expecting to release new chips on it later this year. Samsung are also planning to get into the ARM server business later on which might fully explain the Octa design.

Topic.Title: Only 1 out of 10 Galaxy 4S is powered by Samsung's own Exynos 5 octa

Message.Msg: "You're kidding yourself." Even Jen is now forced to acknowledge that with aapl and samsung having a duopoly in the high end, there is really not enough space left for an independent app processor merchant. Longs here, longs here are still in lala land thinking the mobile guys will ever let themselves create an Intel to an IBM in PC. The mobile guys are very careful to brand their product to be void of the component suppliers. And even Samsung is trying to get out from under the Android brand, let alone the app proc. The 'graphic' advantage or the PD advantage is only in the heads of the longs here. nvda brings absolutely nothing unique to the mobile space. Next battle field: wearables. Here, space compared to a cell phone is like an aircraft carrier to a dinghy. I suspect single chip solutions will rule and nvda ain't got enuf 'cheap' radios to join the party.

Topic.Title: Only 1 out of 10 Galaxy 4S is powered by Samsung's own Exynos 5 octa

Message.Msg: Samsung had to switch its GPU core in Exynos 5 Octa from Mali4xx to PowerVR544MP3 at the very last minute - what a subtle way of admitting its weakness in its mobile SoC competitiveness! Swaying between 2 commodity versions of mobile graphics and not knowing what to do for E5, let alone for the future E6 and E7 - yeah, let the bashers tell us that is a display of strength. LOL

Topic.Title: Only 1 out of 10 Galaxy 4S is powered by Samsung's own Exynos 5 octa

Message.Msg: "So for their high end stuff - it would be buying from QCOM or NVDA - I have no doubt. On the plain vanilla phones - they'll use their own fabs and designs." your second statement has been proven wrong for the last 6 months. Samsung is decidedly NOT doing that for their own fabs and designs to do their plain vanilla entry smart phones. If you are that far off on the second statement, I wouldn't give you any credence for your first statement. Better go find out how far off some of your investment assumptions are. Wearables!! Bring em on!!

Message.Title: Rumors: Samsung ditches Exynos. Galaxy Tab 3 will sport Intel Clovertrail processor (Z2560)
Message.Msg: Sources: rumors circulating all over the web. Below is one of the sites carrying it dailyDOTbhaskarDOTcom/article/GAD-samsung-ditches-exynos-goes-intel-for-galaxy-tab-3-10-4268139-NOR.html

Topic.Title: Rumors: Samsung ditches Exynos. Galaxy Tab 3 will sport Intel Clovertrail processor (Z2560)

Message.Msg: In fact, Samsung is playing catching up in this game, as ASUS released a Clovertrail powered tablet (ASUS Vivotab) in January 2013, and Lenovo's ThinkPad Tab 2 (also powered by Clovertrail) was launched in March this year. There may have been others as well. ASUS and LENOVO offerings have only enjoyed moderate sales so far (one indication is Amazon sales rank). Both tablets trailed popular Android tablets by a wide margin. Samsung's marketing may make a difference - that we shall see in the near future.

Topic.Title: Rumors: Samsung ditches Exynos. Galaxy Tab 3 will sport Intel Clovertrail processor (Z2560)

Message.Msg: I wouldn't doubt that we see a Tegra 4 based devce from Samsung, too.

Topic.Title: Rumors: Samsung ditches Exynos. Galaxy Tab 3 will sport Intel Clovertrail processor (Z2560)

Message.Msg: Samsung already sells an Intel based Win 8 tablet. 10" tablets Android tablets are not selling, so Samsung may be experimenting with Intel.
